 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹפֶרֶת‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Jer.6.29|Jer 6:29]]</sup> (si vera lectio [[BDB#Qr|Qr]]) ==lead== (√ dubious; probably foreign word; compare [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲבָרָא‎</span> lead, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, and (asAramaic loan-word) Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [see [[BDB#Dozy|Dozy]]], [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>152</sup>; perhaps also Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***abaru***</u></abbr>, a metal, ***magnesite*** according to [[BDB#Hilpr|Hilpr]]<sup>Assyriaca i (1894), 80 ff.</sup> [[BDB#Hpt|Hpt]]<sup>ib. 83</sup>); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּכַּר ע‎</span> [[Zech.5.7|Zech 5:7]] ***a round weight*** (disc) ***of lead***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶבֶןהָֿעו‎</span> v[[Zech.5.5|Zech 5:5]] with other metals (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּדִיל‎</span>) : <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוֺ‎</span> [[Ezek.22.18|Ezek 22:18]]; [[Ezek.22.20|Ezek 22:20]]; [[Ezek.27.12|Ezek 27:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָעֹפָ֑רֶת‎</span> [[Num.31.22|Num 31:22]] ([[BDB#P|P]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹפ‎</span> also [[Job.19.24|Job 19:24]] (with which chiselled letters are filled according to [[BDB#Di|Di]] and most; [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] reads <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּע‎</span> ***in*** [a tablet of] ***lead***); also (as flux) [[Jer.6.29|Jer 6:29]] (reading [[BDB#Qr|Qr]]; so [[BDB#Gf|Gf]] [[BDB#Co|Co]]; emendation [[BDB#Gie|Gie]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוֺ‎</span> in simile [[Exod.15.10|Exod 15:10]] (song). <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֵפָ֫תָה‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֵיפָה‎</span> below II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוף‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֵץ‎</span> see II.<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עצה‎</span>.
